commit_message:
Added upload_nodes_info post deployment hook

* added serializer that adds nodes info that will be uploaded
* replaced upload_repo_task with upload_file_task
* removed 'create_serializer' function and replaced with
  'get_serializer_for_cluster'

Change-Id: Ia6fdcbd57fa35f0fe7655ab7e3b96dab0849d191
Implements: blueprint granular-deployment-based-on-tasks

commit_message:
Add a new driver for Fuel Agent

Fuel Agent is open-source, vendor-independent and production-ready
deployment tool. This spec proposes a new driver for Ironic which
will provide deploy with Fuel Agent.

Change-Id: I1e25900c2e6b4e1986106caefd62722137bc103a

commit_message:
Fixed getting task uuid from reponse in perf test

There was a test fragment that tried to take task uuid from response
that was not working. Uuid was wrapped in json_body property,
which was not accessed.

Implements: blueprint 200-nodes-support
Change-Id: I32b2dd93e6518a119e0f5a7ef1d981e59ee7e958

commit_message:
Add 'token' option for easy token retrieval

Just do
fuel token

You can use this in manual curl requests:
curl '<api-url>' -H "X-Auth-Token: $(fuel token)"

DocImpact
Change-Id: I634160beedd347b90a249b073560483f33586b98

commit_message:
Remove API get() for some magnum objects

The get() API was not used by the following objects, just remove it.

1) node
2) pod
3) replication controller
4) service
5) container

Change-Id: I2f578f8d072d772bf34e676b115eccf6c08bac8a

commit_message:
Correct the default log level

When ironic-conductor is run with logging in normal (not debug) mode,
it should log at the INFO level.

This patch also removes some log level settings that duplicate the
defaults.

Closes-bug: #1417934

Change-Id: I38bc87c0d4b650d83c4a6a5ab10d0ee881bf08ba

subject: Import uniform poolmanager from urllib3
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 5202, 'name': 'Erno Kuvaja', 'email': 'jokke@usr.fi', 'username': 'jokke'}, {'_account_id': 6896, 'name': 'Loganathan Parthipan', 'email': 'parthi@hpe.com', 'username': 'parthipan'}, {'_account_id': 8127, 'name': 'Alexander Tivelkov', 'email': 'locher@yandex.ru', 'username': 'ativelkov'}, {'_account_id': 11356, 'name': 'Louis Taylor', 'email': 'louis@kragniz.eu', 'username': 'kragniz'}, {'_account_id': 11650, 'name': 'Tom Cammann', 'email': 'tom.cammann@hpe.com', 'username': 'cammann'}, {'_account_id': 12196, 'name': 'Jun Hong Li', 'email': 'junhongl@cn.ibm.com', 'username': 'Junhongl'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-12-08 10:31:10.000000000', 'files': ['glanceclient/common/https.py', 'requirements.txt', 'tests/test_ssl.py'], 'message': 'Import uniform poolmanager from urllib3

Currently in https.py, it tries to import poolmanager from
requests.packages.urllib3 first, if the module cannot be found,
it then turns to import poolmanager from urllib3.

It works fine for Linux based compute nodes, because the
requests.packages will be removed when installing python-requests,
see: http://pkgs.fedoraproject.org/cgit/python-requests.git/tree/python-requests.spec#n88
However, in Windows hyper-v compute node, the module
requests.packages does be installed. So
requests.packages.urllib3.poolmanager is imported and used.

We then registered a special "glance+https" schema into
poolmanager.pool_classes_by_scheme dict. However, when the request
is sent from glanceclient.common.http.py via self.session.request()
in _request() method, inside the self.session, it is hard coded to
use urllibs.poolmanager.pool_classes_by_scheme to get the
HttpsAdapter, which leads to this problem.

I compared the requests.packages.urllib3.poolmanager and
urllib3.poolmanager, there are no differeces between them. So I
proposed to import the uniform poolmanager from urllib3 in this
patch.

Change-Id: Iea921f865029b92f30ca89c713d0ed529c8cdaa1
Closes-Bug: 1396550
'}]
commit_message:
Import uniform poolmanager from urllib3

Currently in https.py, it tries to import poolmanager from
requests.packages.urllib3 first, if the module cannot be found,
it then turns to import poolmanager from urllib3.

It works fine for Linux based compute nodes, because the
requests.packages will be removed when installing python-requests,
see: http://pkgs.fedoraproject.org/cgit/python-requests.git/tree/python-requests.spec#n88
However, in Windows hyper-v compute node, the module
requests.packages does be installed. So
requests.packages.urllib3.poolmanager is imported and used.

We then registered a special "glance+https" schema into
poolmanager.pool_classes_by_scheme dict. However, when the request
is sent from glanceclient.common.http.py via self.session.request()
in _request() method, inside the self.session, it is hard coded to
use urllibs.poolmanager.pool_classes_by_scheme to get the
HttpsAdapter, which leads to this problem.

I compared the requests.packages.urllib3.poolmanager and
urllib3.poolmanager, there are no differeces between them. So I
proposed to import the uniform poolmanager from urllib3 in this
patch.

Change-Id: Iea921f865029b92f30ca89c713d0ed529c8cdaa1
Closes-Bug: 1396550

commit_message:
Add volume multi attach support

This patch provides changes to Nova that are needed
to support Cinder's multi attach capability.
Cinder volumes now have a shareable flag that is created
at volume creation time. We now pass an attachment uuid
at detach time to tell cinder which instance we are
asking it to detach the volume.

Implements: blueprint multi-attach-volume

python-cinderclient:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/85856/

cinder:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/85847/

Change-Id: I2e78831b4ed86623bb1061e6050ca0010944f457

commit_message:
split api.controllers.v2

The v2 module is a bit large, more than 2700 LOC, we put everything
into it. This patch splits it to several modules by resources.

Change-Id: I8f2b818eb7adc8435ccc59eff834fcd8e5e1d118
Closes-Bug: #1389085

commit_message:
Add command to show pool information for backends

An admin-api extension to show pool info was supported at commit
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/119938/.

This change adds a command to show pool information for backends
using the admin-api. This change also closes the gap for end users.

Partial-Bug: 1403902
Change-Id: I20e0828c5403b73bc44d07eebf08e2aa2deb428a

commit_message:
Adds tasks into Fuel Plug-in Guide

Two more tasks are added to shell and puppet:

* upload_file

* sync

(they are NOT available for plugin developers).

What's more, cwd parameter should be added to the list
with explanation alongside with a note about the default
timeout (300 seconds).

These changes will be made to the Fuel Plug-in Guide only.

Change-Id: I4275ae949dfb716d9344a403ce0fab109578f0dd
Closes-Bug: 1412435

commit_message:
Adds disk iops metrics implementation in Hyper-V Inspector

Regarding the disk metrics, Hyper-V cannot collect read_requests or
write_requests metrics as the other inspectors do, but it can collect
the disk IOPS instead. This patch is targeted to Windows
Hyper-V / Server 2012 R2, Windows 8.1 or newer, since they introduced
disk metrics collection in Hyper-V.

This patch adds iops metrics implementation in Hyper-V Inspector as
well as disk iops and per disk iops pollsters.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I1c6b5d1f3d8b490f0c839124be18deac86979ae7
Implements: blueprint hyper-v-disk-iops-metrics

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-02-04 02:25:08.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/api/app.py', 'ceilometer/tests/api/test_app.py'], 'message': "use debug value for pecan_debug default

Currently, we declare pecan_debug with default=CONF.debug, but which
only gets debug's default value. If debug is set to True, then
pecan_debug remains False. That is because declaration happens in
import time, which is before configuration file parsed.

There are two choices:
1. set pecan_debug default to False, and user needs to enable it
   explicitly
2. set pecan_debug default to None, and if it is not set, then use
   global debug value

This patch chooses the second one.

Note: users who enable global debug while running ceilometer-api
under mod_wsgi with multiple processes need to disable pecan_debug
explicitly after this patch is merged, since previously the pecan_debug
will always be False if they don't configure it.

ref: Ib4a472e3c8d1f34f64a5f3ab993c1211dee8af9a

DocImpact

Change-Id: I9436dbef2272f7b1de769dcb835365f8eb0feeca
"}]
commit_message:
use debug value for pecan_debug default

Currently, we declare pecan_debug with default=CONF.debug, but which
only gets debug's default value. If debug is set to True, then
pecan_debug remains False. That is because declaration happens in
import time, which is before configuration file parsed.

There are two choices:
1. set pecan_debug default to False, and user needs to enable it
   explicitly
2. set pecan_debug default to None, and if it is not set, then use
   global debug value

This patch chooses the second one.

Note: users who enable global debug while running ceilometer-api
under mod_wsgi with multiple processes need to disable pecan_debug
explicitly after this patch is merged, since previously the pecan_debug
will always be False if they don't configure it.

ref: Ib4a472e3c8d1f34f64a5f3ab993c1211dee8af9a

DocImpact

Change-Id: I9436dbef2272f7b1de769dcb835365f8eb0feeca

Log entry when no Floating IP interface present

Having a log entry here in process_router_floating_ip_addresses
would make it easier to understand why the status of floating ips
wasn't updated.

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-01-29 06:36:50.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/targets/tgt.py'], 'message': 'Add retry for tgtadm update when tgt exists

For target creation using tgtadm driver, we create a persistence
file for the target, then send a tgt-admin --update 'name' where
name is the specific persistence file we want to read in and update
from.

It turns out that we can hit race conditions where the persistence
file is written, and an update is requested but target has already
done work to make it believe that the target has already been created.

One thought was to just use "update ALL" but this still seems to have
issues, and changes the error to an account exists failure.

This patch takes the brute force approach and adds the cinder.utils
retry decorator to the tgt-admin --update command.  To do this
we just break out the tgt-admin --update call into it's own method
and add the decorator to it.

Closes-Bug: #1398078

Change-Id: Ic72fb5f4fca70a7e7d1c306efe19674fd7e42cd6
'}]
commit_message:
Add retry for tgtadm update when tgt exists

For target creation using tgtadm driver, we create a persistence
file for the target, then send a tgt-admin --update 'name' where
name is the specific persistence file we want to read in and update
from.

It turns out that we can hit race conditions where the persistence
file is written, and an update is requested but target has already
done work to make it believe that the target has already been created.

One thought was to just use "update ALL" but this still seems to have
issues, and changes the error to an account exists failure.

This patch takes the brute force approach and adds the cinder.utils
retry decorator to the tgt-admin --update command.  To do this
we just break out the tgt-admin --update call into it's own method
and add the decorator to it.

Closes-Bug: #1398078

Change-Id: Ic72fb5f4fca70a7e7d1c306efe19674fd7e42cd6

commit_message:
Stop running the non-voting neutron-full-pg job in the gate

This commit removes the neutron-pg-full job from the gate pipeline in
the integrate-gate-neutron template. This job is set to be non-voting
and we shouldn't waste resources in the gate on non-voting jobs.

Change-Id: Ie4c7a9db4f62c1f0218bfecb62bb9922791aa405

subject: demo patch for help-panel widget
revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2015-01-30 21:53:29.000000000', 'files': ['horizon/static/angular/launch-instance/launch-instance.help.html', 'horizon/templates/base.html'], 'message': 'demo patch for help-panel widget

This patch is not going to be checked in. The only purpose for it is
to show code reviewers the usage of help-panel widget - an Angular
-based widget directive.

Please find the examples of usage in spalsh.html:
1) Inline help information in HTML format.
2) URL link of help HTML file via  ng-include.

Note:

1. the parent element of <help-panel> should have css style
overflow: hiddin, which makes sense for UI outer containers. In the
case a UI container have scrollable content, the content should be
hosted in a content container and the <help-panel> should not be a
child element of the content contianer.

2. To make the demo simple, I just use <body> as the container and set
the css style for it to be overflow: hidden. In real case, <body>
should not be a container for <help-panel>, unless the whole horizon
is a single-page web application.

Change-Id: Ia42498a7e32b33829c22420b7eb639929e33aaae
Link: Implementation of help-panel widget: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/148031/3
'}]
commit_message:
demo patch for help-panel widget

This patch is not going to be checked in. The only purpose for it is
to show code reviewers the usage of help-panel widget - an Angular
-based widget directive.

Please find the examples of usage in spalsh.html:
1) Inline help information in HTML format.
2) URL link of help HTML file via  ng-include.

Note:

1. the parent element of <help-panel> should have css style
overflow: hiddin, which makes sense for UI outer containers. In the
case a UI container have scrollable content, the content should be
hosted in a content container and the <help-panel> should not be a
child element of the content contianer.

2. To make the demo simple, I just use <body> as the container and set
the css style for it to be overflow: hidden. In real case, <body>
should not be a container for <help-panel>, unless the whole horizon
is a single-page web application.

Change-Id: Ia42498a7e32b33829c22420b7eb639929e33aaae
Link: Implementation of help-panel widget: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/148031/3

commit_message:
Fix argument order in assertEqual: tests/test_image_utils.py

The assertEqual in cinder/tests/test_image_utils.py is using
incorrect argument order (observed, expected), which causes the
error message about mismatch to be reversed if the test case fails.
Change it to (expected, observed).

Change-Id: I06d86c024646337719b58cc8a38a820e1a3af51f
Partial-Bug: #1259292

commit_message:
Sync latest generator.py from oslo.config

The Cinder's generator.py implements own _get_my_ip which
duplicates with oslo.utils.netutils.get_my_ipv4's. The latest
generator.py from oslo.config already fixed this issue. So sync
generator.py from oslo.config.

Change-Id: I4b9556680a63f7f9a9d6e5f359e7351400bf3280

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-12-20 01:15:38.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/scheduler/filter_scheduler.py', 'cinder/tests/scheduler/test_filter_scheduler.py'], 'message': 'Allow the w/o pool format for "migrate" and "manage" commands

From Juno, Pool-aware scheduler was introduced. As a result,
destination format of "migrate" and "manage" commands were
changed as it included pool name.
This breaks command line backward compatibility and user
have to specify pool name even if the backend driver does
not support Pool-aware scheduler.

To keep backward compatibility, this patch allows the w/o pool
format only if the destination does not have a pool.

w/o pool: "host@backend-name"
w/  pool: "host@backend-name#pool"

Closes-Bug: 1403902
Change-Id: I03b6f537231fbe514543eb4490af9702340d2ef1
'}]
commit_message:
Allow the w/o pool format for "migrate" and "manage" commands

From Juno, Pool-aware scheduler was introduced. As a result,
destination format of "migrate" and "manage" commands were
changed as it included pool name.
This breaks command line backward compatibility and user
have to specify pool name even if the backend driver does
not support Pool-aware scheduler.

To keep backward compatibility, this patch allows the w/o pool
format only if the destination does not have a pool.

w/o pool: "host@backend-name"
w/  pool: "host@backend-name#pool"

Closes-Bug: 1403902
Change-Id: I03b6f537231fbe514543eb4490af9702340d2ef1

commit_message:
Catch workflow errors

Avoid keeping workflow in zombie state: on unexpected errors
fail the workflow execution and save error information. If possible,
fail the correspondent tasks, too.

Done:
- [x] Introduce state_info into Execution, fill it with error info
when workflow fails.
- [x] Add error handlers to `on_task_result` and `run_task`
- [x] Add error handlers and tests to `start_workflow`
- [x] Add tests for YAQL eval exceptions
- [x] Add error handler and tests to `resume_worklfow`

TODO: 
- [ ] Make _fail_workflow public and let user fail workflow via API
(on separate commit)

Closes-bug: 1415886
Change-Id: Ib1fd661580d3a426dbbc7401a3622a98c7840e00

commit_message:
Workaround Fedora vs. pip

After the pip 6.0.7 release devstack started to fail on
 systems which contains old python package with egg-info file.
https://github.com/pypa/pip/issues/2384

Skipping pip==6.0.7 on Fedora, it is expted to be fixed in
pip>6.0.7.

Change-Id: I58c1f5ee0fda7620581f42b3aef0954d6d746389

subject: VMware: enable a cache prefix configuration parameter
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 782, 'name': 'John Garbutt', 'email': 'john.garbutt@stackhpc.com', 'username': 'johngarbutt'}, {'_account_id': 1653, 'name': 'garyk', 'email': 'gkotton@vmware.com', 'username': 'garyk'}, {'_account_id': 1779, 'name': 'Daniel Berrange', 'email': 'berrange@redhat.com', 'username': 'berrange'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 5638, 'name': 'Davanum Srinivas', 'email': 'davanum@gmail.com', 'username': 'dims-v'}, {'_account_id': 6167, 'name': "Ken'ichi Ohmichi", 'email': 'ken1ohmichi@gmail.com', 'username': 'oomichi'}, {'_account_id': 8412, 'name': 'Mike Durnosvistov', 'email': 'glacierr.dev@gmail.com', 'username': 'mdurnosvistov'}, {'_account_id': 8871, 'name': 'Elastic Recheck', 'username': 'elasticrecheck'}, {'_account_id': 9008, 'name': 'VMware NSX CI', 'username': 'vmwareminesweeper', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9569, 'name': 'Sergey Nikitin', 'email': 'nikitinserv@gmail.com', 'username': 'snikitin'}, {'_account_id': 9578, 'name': 'DB Datasets CI', 'email': 'turbo-hipster@lists.rcbops.com', 'username': 'turbo-hipster', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2014-12-08 15:42:01.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/vmwareapi/vmops.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/vmwareapi/test_vmops.py'], 'message': 'VMware: enable a cache prefix configuration parameter

Background:
Images that are stored in the cache folder will be stored in a folder whose
name is the image ID. In the event that an image is discovered to be no longer
used then a timestamp will be added to the image folder.
At each aging iteration we check if the image can be aged.
This is done by comparing the current nova compute time to the time embedded
in the timestamp. If the time exceeds the configured aging time then
the parent folder, that is the image ID folder, will be deleted.
That effectively ages the cached image.
If an image is used then the timestamps will be deleted.

When accessing a timestamp we make use of locking. This ensures that aging
will not delete an image during the spawn operation. When spawning
the timestamp folder will be locked and the timestamps will be purged.
This will ensure that a image is not deleted during the spawn.

In order to ensure that there is not a race between compute nodes each
compute node will have its own cache directory on the VMware datastore.

This is terrible costly when using more than one compute node (which is
a MUST for HA).

Due to the fact that we are using a nova lock utils if the compute nodes
have a shared file system then the locking is valid for all compute nodes.
In order to enable an administrator this option we provide a new
configuration parameter to enable multiple compute nodes to use the same
cache folder on the backend datastore. NOTE that this can only be done
when the compute nodes are running on the same host or the compute nodes
have a shared file system.

DocImpact
   New variable - cache_prefix
   This is in the vmware section

Change-Id: I02e758af19cf3a652a5c39d02904e73a1088fe60
'}]
commit_message:
VMware: enable a cache prefix configuration parameter

Background:
Images that are stored in the cache folder will be stored in a folder whose
name is the image ID. In the event that an image is discovered to be no longer
used then a timestamp will be added to the image folder.
At each aging iteration we check if the image can be aged.
This is done by comparing the current nova compute time to the time embedded
in the timestamp. If the time exceeds the configured aging time then
the parent folder, that is the image ID folder, will be deleted.
That effectively ages the cached image.
If an image is used then the timestamps will be deleted.

When accessing a timestamp we make use of locking. This ensures that aging
will not delete an image during the spawn operation. When spawning
the timestamp folder will be locked and the timestamps will be purged.
This will ensure that a image is not deleted during the spawn.

In order to ensure that there is not a race between compute nodes each
compute node will have its own cache directory on the VMware datastore.

This is terrible costly when using more than one compute node (which is
a MUST for HA).

Due to the fact that we are using a nova lock utils if the compute nodes
have a shared file system then the locking is valid for all compute nodes.
In order to enable an administrator this option we provide a new
configuration parameter to enable multiple compute nodes to use the same
cache folder on the backend datastore. NOTE that this can only be done
when the compute nodes are running on the same host or the compute nodes
have a shared file system.

DocImpact
   New variable - cache_prefix
   This is in the vmware section

Taskmanager.Manager mistakenly populates context.tenant with

to access the wrong management_url:
<nova_compute_url>/<nova_proxy_admin_tenant_name>.

This fix can correct the nova url by replacing tenant_name

DocImpact

commit_message:
Add nova_proxy_admin_tenant_id to make nova_compute_url effective

Taskmanager.Manager mistakenly populates context.tenant with
admin's tenant name instead of admin's tenant id which results
to access the wrong management_url:
<nova_compute_url>/<nova_proxy_admin_tenant_name>.

This fix can correct the nova url by replacing tenant_name
to tenant_id.

Besides, when creating nova client, bypass_url should be existed
in order to re-authenticate. This is also necessary to make this
patch work.

DocImpact
deprecating option 'nova_proxy_admin_tenant_name'
to 'nova_proxy_admin_tenant_id'

Change-Id: I1c976168db2752f394ff455057d03b1ebba7c984
Closes-Bug: #1289101

subject: Tweak the WBE diagram (and present it as an svg)
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-02-05 01:12:04.000000000', 'files': ['doc/diagrams/worker-engine.graffle.tgz', 'doc/source/img/worker-engine.png', 'doc/source/workers.rst', 'doc/source/img/worker-engine.svg'], 'message': "Tweak the WBE diagram (and present it as an svg)

Adjust parts of the WBE to reflect a little better what
the components do and explain better arrows mean and turn it
into an svg to scale and present better (and just in generally look
better on all svg supporting browsers; which is all browsers
now-a-days).

* Changes the diagram to add 'executor' to engine block.
* Adjusts communication for engine -> proxy -> workers is
  composed of task requests to revert/execute.
* Adjusts communication for worker -> proxy -> engine is
  more of capabilities, notifications and results (from
  prior execute/revert) requests.
* Adds endpoints into worker box. 
* Changes to using 'executor' + threads in worker; the thing
  that the worker uses to actually execute work (this is
  different than the executor in the engine box, although they
  are somewhat related in what they do...).

Change-Id: I068bdd4f912ac05f2416eb03fc07cd68656b9a43
"}]
commit_message:
Tweak the WBE diagram (and present it as an svg)

Adjust parts of the WBE to reflect a little better what
the components do and explain better arrows mean and turn it
into an svg to scale and present better (and just in generally look
better on all svg supporting browsers; which is all browsers
now-a-days).

* Changes the diagram to add 'executor' to engine block.
* Adjusts communication for engine -> proxy -> workers is
  composed of task requests to revert/execute.
* Adjusts communication for worker -> proxy -> engine is
  more of capabilities, notifications and results (from
  prior execute/revert) requests.
* Adds endpoints into worker box. 
* Changes to using 'executor' + threads in worker; the thing
  that the worker uses to actually execute work (this is
  different than the executor in the engine box, although they
  are somewhat related in what they do...).

Change-Id: I068bdd4f912ac05f2416eb03fc07cd68656b9a43

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2015-02-03 04:12:00.000000000', 'files': ['glance/tests/var/certificate.crt', 'glance/tests/var/ca.crt', 'glance/tests/functional/v1/test_ssl.py', 'glance/tests/var/ca.key', 'glance/tests/functional/test_ssl.py'], 'message': "Rewrite SSL tests

Old tests did not ensure the valid certificate, and did not only test
HTTPS. Revised tests are API agnostic, use a certificate valid for
'127.0.0.1' (old certificate incorrectly had common name of 'Glance CA'
so could not be validated) through the authority chain, but does not
duplicate testing of the API. Included the ca.key matching the ca.crt
as well to simplify generation of a replacement certificate in the
future.

Change-Id: Ibe49d82cca9fd0148c60c501bf074c499ada8a29
Closes-Bug: 1064052
"}]
commit_message:
Rewrite SSL tests

Old tests did not ensure the valid certificate, and did not only test
HTTPS. Revised tests are API agnostic, use a certificate valid for
'127.0.0.1' (old certificate incorrectly had common name of 'Glance CA'
so could not be validated) through the authority chain, but does not
duplicate testing of the API. Included the ca.key matching the ca.crt
as well to simplify generation of a replacement certificate in the
future.

Change-Id: Ibe49d82cca9fd0148c60c501bf074c499ada8a29
Closes-Bug: 1064052

[{'number': 9, 'created': '2015-02-05 00:18:23.000000000', 'files': ['etc/metadefs/software-runtimes.json', 'etc/metadefs/software-webservers.json', 'etc/metadefs/software-databases.json'], 'message': 'Software Metadata Definitions

The will provide a base library of metadata definitions for
various common software products, components, and libraries that
may exist on particular image (or volume or instance). These
metadata definitions will make it easier for end users and
admins to easily describe the software and its properties.
This information will enable an improved and faster user
experience for applying software metadata, searching based
on software metadata, and viewing the software information
about an image.

Various improvements in horizon are underway to take
advantage of this metadata. For example, a user launching
an instance will be able to expand the image row to see
additional information about the image.  This will include
providing the metadata definition for properties on the image.
This same information will also be visible from the image and
instance details page.

Change-Id: I63fa40f9eae8dfb602cf0c9c3f0dd7f0d1a65af0
Implements: blueprint software-metadefs
'}]
commit_message:
Software Metadata Definitions

The will provide a base library of metadata definitions for
various common software products, components, and libraries that
may exist on particular image (or volume or instance). These
metadata definitions will make it easier for end users and
admins to easily describe the software and its properties.
This information will enable an improved and faster user
experience for applying software metadata, searching based
on software metadata, and viewing the software information
about an image.

Various improvements in horizon are underway to take
advantage of this metadata. For example, a user launching
an instance will be able to expand the image row to see
additional information about the image.  This will include
providing the metadata definition for properties on the image.
This same information will also be visible from the image and
instance details page.

Change-Id: I63fa40f9eae8dfb602cf0c9c3f0dd7f0d1a65af0
Implements: blueprint software-metadefs

commit_message:
fix the wrong update logic of catalog kvs driver

The update logic of catalog objects in kvs driver is wrong. Currently,
it just overwrites the old one rather than update.

Change-Id: I9fa582a71e1ad9b6fa06e2ffbff1472aeb975a54
Closes-Bug: #1384112

subject: Remove all CONF values from base service_client
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-01-15 04:49:50.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/clients.py', 'tempest/common/service_client.py'], 'message': 'Remove all CONF values from base service_client

For moving service clients of all projects to tempest-lib, we need to
remove all CONF values from all service clients.
This patch adds set_service_client_defaults() for setting default CONF
values and remove all CONF values from base service_client as the first
step.
After this patch, we still need to remove all CONF values from each
service client. and we can extend set_service_client_defaults() for
doing that.

Change-Id: I8f9876e4b5aac52661da496defaa6dee2412e332
'}]
commit_message:
Remove all CONF values from base service_client

For moving service clients of all projects to tempest-lib, we need to
remove all CONF values from all service clients.
This patch adds set_service_client_defaults() for setting default CONF
values and remove all CONF values from base service_client as the first
step.
After this patch, we still need to remove all CONF values from each
service client. and we can extend set_service_client_defaults() for
doing that.

Change-Id: I8f9876e4b5aac52661da496defaa6dee2412e332

commit_message:
Unskip test_volume_boot_pattern

"Boot from volume" is one of important features, but the feature
is not tested on the gate due to bug/1373513.
This patch removes the skip for getting debugging information if
there are still some problems.

Related-Bug: #1373513
Change-Id: Iab79563d51b0cc1fd3e0724df9bde150cde70097

As http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-January/055549.html
current messages in error responses are not consistent and it is difficult
to handle them from API consumers. On the other hand, nova v2.1 API has

commit_message:
Add common return_bad_request_due_to_nonexistence

As http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-January/055549.html
current messages in error responses are not consistent and it is difficult
to handle them from API consumers. On the other hand, nova v2.1 API has
implemented consistent messages by JSONSchema and these messages are based
on WSME's ones for OpenStack consistency.
This patch applies the same message format to some messages of nonexistent
resources.

Change-Id: If9c2fade68a5643caf755568b381e4f07b62f1ce

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2015-02-05 00:24:38.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/services/baremetal/v1/json/__init__.py', 'tempest/clients.py', 'tempest/services/baremetal/v1/json/baremetal_client.py', 'tempest/services/baremetal/v1/client_json.py'], 'message': "Remove inheritance from baremetal client

baremetal client has complicated inheritance because Tempest tested
XML tests and the base part of the client was necessary for both XML
and JSON. However, XML tests have been already removed from Tempest
and the inheritance is unnecessary and the code is complicated.
The this patch removes the inheritance and renames the file name of
the client for fittig to the other clients' names.

Change-Id: I0a798fb146edd53b7a61bf30689b93cbd90ddac0
"}]
commit_message:
Remove inheritance from baremetal client

baremetal client has complicated inheritance because Tempest tested
XML tests and the base part of the client was necessary for both XML
and JSON. However, XML tests have been already removed from Tempest
and the inheritance is unnecessary and the code is complicated.
The this patch removes the inheritance and renames the file name of
the client for fittig to the other clients' names.

Change-Id: I0a798fb146edd53b7a61bf30689b93cbd90ddac0

subject: handle missing project/tenant when using ldap backend
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-01-26 14:44:31.000000000', 'files': ['spec/unit/provider/keystone_user/openstack_spec.rb', 'lib/puppet/provider/keystone.rb', 'lib/puppet/provider/keystone_user/openstack.rb', 'spec/unit/provider/openstack_spec.rb', 'lib/puppet/type/keystone_user.rb', 'lib/puppet/provider/openstack.rb'], 'message': "handle missing project/tenant when using ldap backend

The project/tenant is only stored with the user when using
the sql (default) backend.  This means calls like user list
and user show will not show the default project.  For getting
the project/tenant, if it is not present in the instances
information provided by user list --long, we don't actually
get the project/tenant, we just check to see if the user is
assigned to the given tenant/project.  For setting the
project/tenant, this is usually done with user create, but when
ldap is read-only, we have to use role add to add the user to a
default _member_ role and at the same time assign the user to a
given project/tenant.  This also adds support for using the
openstack $obj show commands which return --format shell output,
and return a hash of key/value pairs.

Closes-Bug: #1391373
Change-Id: I9a4f72f9a1de200b324aa52eb3ea90d15423c062
(cherry picked from commit 1b8010e44fb3a6ec8554dc813314e7e254378da9)
"}]
commit_message:
handle missing project/tenant when using ldap backend

The project/tenant is only stored with the user when using
the sql (default) backend.  This means calls like user list
and user show will not show the default project.  For getting
the project/tenant, if it is not present in the instances
information provided by user list --long, we don't actually
get the project/tenant, we just check to see if the user is
assigned to the given tenant/project.  For setting the
project/tenant, this is usually done with user create, but when
ldap is read-only, we have to use role add to add the user to a
default _member_ role and at the same time assign the user to a
given project/tenant.  This also adds support for using the
openstack $obj show commands which return --format shell output,
and return a hash of key/value pairs.

Closes-Bug: #1391373
Change-Id: I9a4f72f9a1de200b324aa52eb3ea90d15423c062
(cherry picked from commit 1b8010e44fb3a6ec8554dc813314e7e254378da9)

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 3012, 'name': 'Dina Belova', 'email': 'dbelova@mirantis.com', 'username': 'dbelova'}, {'_account_id': 4491, 'name': 'Lianhao Lu', 'email': 'lianhao.lu@intel.com', 'username': 'lianhao-lu'}, {'_account_id': 6676, 'name': 'zqfan', 'email': 'aji.zqfan@gmail.com', 'username': 'aji-zqfan'}, {'_account_id': 7052, 'name': 'Fabio Giannetti', 'email': 'fgiannet@cisco.com', 'username': 'fabgia'}, {'_account_id': 7478, 'name': 'Nadya Shakhat', 'email': 'nadmi4@gmail.com', 'username': 'nprivalova'}, {'_account_id': 7729, 'name': 'Ilya Tyaptin', 'email': 'ityaptin@mirantis.com', 'username': 'ityaptin'}, {'_account_id': 8871, 'name': 'Elastic Recheck', 'username': 'elasticrecheck'}, {'_account_id': 10987, 'name': 'Igor Degtiarov', 'username': 'tovstun', 'inactive': True}, {'_account_id': 11564, 'name': 'Chris Dent', 'email': 'cdent@anticdent.org', 'username': 'chdent'}, {'_account_id': 14118, 'name': 'mizeng', 'email': 'mizeng@ebaysf.com', 'username': 'mizeng'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 12, 'created': '2015-02-04 01:40:34.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/opts.py', 'doc/source/architecture.rst', 'ceilometer/agent/base.py'], 'message': "Shuffle agents to send request

For each polling interval, Ceilometer compute agent will trigger
nova client directly to acquire the list of VMs.

However, there's a potential risk that the workload for nova client
will increases proportional to the number of Ceilometer compute
agents. In other word, there's a possibility that thousands of
ceilometer compute agents will call nova client in a very short time
period which may lead large number of requests to nova client in
short time. As a result, the nova client can not handle so many
requests in short time, and ceilometer compute agent can't fetch
metrics.

So we here shuffle agents to start polling task in order to fluff up
the time of sending request to nova or other components to avoid
large number of requests in short time. This would be more
performance effective and reliable.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I12e3f104fc92fe15adc05e2b981627f31ee5bfaa
Closes-bug: #1412613
"}]
commit_message:
Shuffle agents to send request

For each polling interval, Ceilometer compute agent will trigger
nova client directly to acquire the list of VMs.

However, there's a potential risk that the workload for nova client
will increases proportional to the number of Ceilometer compute
agents. In other word, there's a possibility that thousands of
ceilometer compute agents will call nova client in a very short time
period which may lead large number of requests to nova client in
short time. As a result, the nova client can not handle so many
requests in short time, and ceilometer compute agent can't fetch
metrics.

So we here shuffle agents to start polling task in order to fluff up
the time of sending request to nova or other components to avoid
large number of requests in short time. This would be more
performance effective and reliable.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I12e3f104fc92fe15adc05e2b981627f31ee5bfaa
Closes-bug: #1412613

'with a cron expression, whereas its duration'.

revisions:

Now Tempest supports JSON tests only without XML ones, but a
base baremetal client contains still an option for switching
de/serializers and it makes the code a little difficult.

Then, this patch moves JSON de/serializers for clarifying it
supports only JSON and easy code.
In addition, this patch removes "object_type" from serialize()

Change-Id: Id96af61c422cb4e9a6d89f4ede6701e3c9d5f3c5
'}]
commit_message:
Move JSON de/serializers to base baremetal client

Now Tempest supports JSON tests only without XML ones, but a
base baremetal client contains still an option for switching
de/serializers and it makes the code a little difficult.

Then, this patch moves JSON de/serializers for clarifying it
supports only JSON and easy code.
In addition, this patch removes "object_type" from serialize()
because now passed values are 'node', 'chassis' and  'port'
and they are not used for serializing at all.

Change-Id: Id96af61c422cb4e9a6d89f4ede6701e3c9d5f3c5

commit_message:
Fixes the EQL driver CI tests AttributeError

Moved the ssh object back to a 'with' Block to
fix the AttributeError thrown by the GeneralContextManager
in the Eqlx CI tests

Fixed the unit tests to mock the enter and exit methods
instead

Closes-Bug: #1417772

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-01-13 22:31:30.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_volume.py'], 'message': "fix reversed usage of self.assertEqual in libvirt unit tests

The correct format for assertEqual is assertEqual(expected, actual),
but the usage is reveresed in a lot of places to be
assertEqual(actual, expected).

Now if unit tests fail on such an assertEqual, the output appears
reversed and can be potentially misleading while debugging failed
 tests as expected output will show up as 'actual'

This patch fixes all such reversed uses in test_volume.py

Change-Id: Idfa312a291eac9ff1f9aae2e38f002058913e1d2
"}]
commit_message:
fix reversed usage of self.assertEqual in libvirt unit tests

The correct format for assertEqual is assertEqual(expected, actual),
but the usage is reveresed in a lot of places to be
assertEqual(actual, expected).

Now if unit tests fail on such an assertEqual, the output appears
reversed and can be potentially misleading while debugging failed
 tests as expected output will show up as 'actual'

This patch fixes all such reversed uses in test_volume.py

Change-Id: Idfa312a291eac9ff1f9aae2e38f002058913e1d2

commit_message:
Pool-aware Scheduler Support

This change introduces pool-aware scheduler to address the need for
supporting multiple pools from one storage controller.
Derived from the Cinder Implementation of Pool-aware Scheduler -
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/98715/ and
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/119938

Implements blueprint: dynamic-storage-pools

Change-Id: I3aee5ed1f96f972f7d40fbd981393559587c1a23

commit_message:
Fix tests for ServerContraint

The test case for ServerConstraint was using the wrong parent class,
since it was not using anything from its setUp.
This small improvement avoids creating unnecessary mocks and stubs
by using the HeatTestCase as parent directly.

Change-Id: I8a34967e76c82d2c7755b0c0fe83038071e1b0f7

commit_message:
Rename v1_1 to v2

Module novaclient.v1_1 is used as implementation of V1.1, V2 and V3.
Since future development(microversioning) will be done across V2,
implementation should be done in appropriate module(to prevent misleading).

Despite the fact that implementation for all versions are equal, discover
method for contrib path worked only for v1.1. This patch fixes this bug and
modifies shell tests to check all versions.

Change-Id: Ib6798f4dfe177586302141f522dc593560ce6a5b

commit_message:
update docstring for driver_periodic_task's parallel param

This updates the docstring for the parallel parameter to make it more
obvious what a value of False means; that it will cause the conductor's
other periodic tasks to be blocked.

'spacing=5' means to run every 5 seconds.

commit_message:
Decrease rpc timeout after agent receives SIGTERM

The patch sets different timeout to rpc api objects in OVS agent after
SIGTERM is received. Given timeout is configurable. This action prevents
long waiting for rpc call() methods to timeout and decreases amount of time
needed to successfully stopping OVS agent.

DocImpact
Change-Id: I3026775e813a74bad9e0bca3be1f535212a2e417
Closes-Bug: 1408334

subject: reset-state should warn that it is DB only
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-02-04 20:25:24.000000000', 'files': ['cinderclient/v2/shell.py'], 'message': "reset-state should warn that it is DB only

The python-cinderclient command 'reset-state' will only change the state in
the Cinder database, without affecting any connection/export of a volume from
the driver backend to a Nova compute host/instance.
The Doc string should explicitly state that this is the case, and Warn that it
might result in an unusable volume, i.e. a volume is set to 'available' in the
Cinder DB, but is still attached and therefore cannot be attached to another
instance, nor detached.

Change-Id: Iee66570dbb93776490ae8fb663a7f835dc496bc2
Closes-Bug: 1417273
"}]
commit_message:
reset-state should warn that it is DB only

The python-cinderclient command 'reset-state' will only change the state in
the Cinder database, without affecting any connection/export of a volume from
the driver backend to a Nova compute host/instance.
The Doc string should explicitly state that this is the case, and Warn that it
might result in an unusable volume, i.e. a volume is set to 'available' in the
Cinder DB, but is still attached and therefore cannot be attached to another
instance, nor detached.

Change-Id: Iee66570dbb93776490ae8fb663a7f835dc496bc2
Closes-Bug: 1417273

subject: Skip None id when getting security_group_ids
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-01-29 08:30:18.000000000', 'files': ['neutronclient/neutron/v2_0/securitygroup.py', 'neutronclient/tests/unit/test_cli20_securitygroup.py'], 'message': 'Skip None id when getting security_group_ids

When getting security_group_ids in securitygroup.py, a None id is
included into the list due to the remote group id is Null when the
security group rule direction is egress.
And this causes the calculation of the number of chunk_size is
1 more than the number it should be.
Then the request page size excess the MAX request page size
Then the RequestURITooLong exception happens again, and finally
the commend fails.

Co-Authored-By: Furukawa, Yushiro <y.furukawa_2@jp.fujitsu.com>
Change-Id: Ib671cf3ddc6827793c4a86d2d3c8a34957f5dfd3
Related-Bug: 1271462
Closes-Bug: 1415692
'}]
commit_message:
Skip None id when getting security_group_ids

When getting security_group_ids in securitygroup.py, a None id is
included into the list due to the remote group id is Null when the
security group rule direction is egress.
And this causes the calculation of the number of chunk_size is
1 more than the number it should be.
Then the request page size excess the MAX request page size
Then the RequestURITooLong exception happens again, and finally
the commend fails.

Co-Authored-By: Furukawa, Yushiro <y.furukawa_2@jp.fujitsu.com>
Change-Id: Ib671cf3ddc6827793c4a86d2d3c8a34957f5dfd3
Related-Bug: 1271462
Closes-Bug: 1415692

subject: Disable progress bar if image is piped into client
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-01-06 10:36:01.000000000', 'files': ['glanceclient/v1/shell.py', 'glanceclient/v2/shell.py'], 'message': 'Disable progress bar if image is piped into client

Previously, running:

    cat something.img | glance image-create --progress --container-format=bare --disk-format=raw

or

    cat something.img | glance --os-image-api-version 2 image-upload --progress <image id>

would result in an error. This error was caused by the length of the
input being unknown, so the overall progress cannot be found.

This patch disables the progress bar whenever the size of the input file
cannot be determined.

Change-Id: I6bfef7441864b638194126880241cc2c96d5b18b
Closes-Bug: #1402746
'}]
commit_message:
Disable progress bar if image is piped into client

Previously, running:

    cat something.img | glance image-create --progress --container-format=bare --disk-format=raw

or

    cat something.img | glance --os-image-api-version 2 image-upload --progress <image id>

would result in an error. This error was caused by the length of the
input being unknown, so the overall progress cannot be found.

This patch disables the progress bar whenever the size of the input file
cannot be determined.

Change-Id: I6bfef7441864b638194126880241cc2c96d5b18b
Closes-Bug: #1402746

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-01-08 17:01:17.000000000', 'files': ['glanceclient/v1/shell.py'], 'message': 'Add validation to --property-filter in v1 shell

Previously, using --property-filter with invalid arguments resulted in
a rather cryptic error message:

    $ glance image-list --property-filter name
    dictionary update sequence element #0 has length 1; 2 is required

Now, something which is human decipherable is printed:

    $ glance image-list --property-filter name
    Argument --property-filter requires properties in the format KEY=VALUE

Change-Id: I61d19894fd8864bdca2fa3f627da3c7eb1341c51
'}]
commit_message:
Add validation to --property-filter in v1 shell

Previously, using --property-filter with invalid arguments resulted in
a rather cryptic error message:

    $ glance image-list --property-filter name
    dictionary update sequence element #0 has length 1; 2 is required

Now, something which is human decipherable is printed:

    $ glance image-list --property-filter name
    Argument --property-filter requires properties in the format KEY=VALUE

Change-Id: I61d19894fd8864bdca2fa3f627da3c7eb1341c51

commit_message:
Improve description text for IP allocations

This commit updates the descriptions for NeutronPublicInterfaceIP,
ControlFixedIPs, and NeutronPublicInterfaceDefaultRoute to provide
greater clarity as to what they are used for, meanwhile delineating
that NeutronPublicInterfaceIP is not intended for use in HA mode.

Change-Id: I8d03724dc6793e38a4aee28134e088644fd8269e
Closes-Bug: #1348234

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2015-02-03 15:16:06.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/index.rst', 'doc/ext/support_matrix.py', 'doc/source/_static/support-matrix.css', 'doc/source/support-matrix.ini', 'doc/source/support-matrix.rst', 'doc/source/conf.py'], 'message': 'Add formal doc recording hypervisor feature capability matrix

Add document to replace / obsolete the giant table on

  https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/HypervisorSupportMatrix

This initial draft is a fairly straightforward conversion of
that table. Over time, it needs much work to improve the coverage
of API operations and and coverage of important configuration
information that users will care about.

It is using the .ini file syntax in order to record the data in
an easily machine parsable format, while remaining human friendly
by avoiding the syntax heavy approach of XML / JSON / YAML

An extension is registered with sphinx that can convert the
.ini file content into docutils content that then gets rendered
into the developer docs, linked from the index page

Change-Id: I4d3db4bce5737dba30a026a11083a9ea64459cd4
'}]
commit_message:
Add formal doc recording hypervisor feature capability matrix

Add document to replace / obsolete the giant table on

  https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/HypervisorSupportMatrix

This initial draft is a fairly straightforward conversion of
that table. Over time, it needs much work to improve the coverage
of API operations and and coverage of important configuration
information that users will care about.

It is using the .ini file syntax in order to record the data in
an easily machine parsable format, while remaining human friendly
by avoiding the syntax heavy approach of XML / JSON / YAML

An extension is registered with sphinx that can convert the
.ini file content into docutils content that then gets rendered
into the developer docs, linked from the index page

Change-Id: I4d3db4bce5737dba30a026a11083a9ea64459cd4

digest operations such as MD5 or SHA-512.

This change implements the LBaaS v2 object model changes necessary for

While many constructs are the same as in v1, many are not, and have
therefore been namespaced under lb/v2.

This client now supports both the v1 and v2 implementations
simultaneously. v1 commands retain their original form:

and v2 commands take the form:

Partially-implements: blueprint lbaas-api-and-objmodel-improvement

commit_message:
Implement LBaaS object model v2

This change implements the LBaaS v2 object model changes necessary for
python-neutronclient. It includes new objects loadbalancer and listener,
as well as new implementations for pool, member, and healthmonitor.
While many constructs are the same as in v1, many are not, and have
therefore been namespaced under lb/v2.

This client now supports both the v1 and v2 implementations
simultaneously. v1 commands retain their original form:
neutron lb-<object>-<command>

and v2 commands take the form:
neutron lbaas-<object>-<command>

Co-Authored-By: Michael Johnson <johnsom@hp.com>
Change-Id: I970b1de39d0dd8872459a584dd1f5c9110796ac9
Partially-implements: blueprint lbaas-api-and-objmodel-improvement
DocImpact

commit_message:
Create post test script helper functions to share

Group together functions that several post_test_hook.sh scripts can
use to remove duplication. This commit provides the script and
subsequent commits will use the script and remove the functions from
repo post_test_hook.sh scripts in each repo.

Change-Id: Icc8503a8cb0c16a80ec61d943753209f90cd478d

commit_message:
Remove emit_time from the collector and put it into the forwarder.

Fixed the service dimension for api checks on various openstack services
so that it matches that of the other service checks, allowing for it to
be grouped together.

Modified the config so a config in the working dir can be used this is
helpful for testing. Additionally I fixed up few tests and removed
some no longer used, there is a lot of work with test left unfinished

Change-Id: Ic5b127db41c174735f1436bb511f00e271274cb0

commit_message:
PCI NUMA filtering

Add pci device numa awareness to scheduling logic.
The NUMA topology filter is modified to consider PCI device NUMA node
locality during guest placement.
When a VM has a defined NUMA topology it will be placed on host numa
nodes that have requested pci devices.
If a VM doesn't have a NUMA topology if possible it will be placed in
one host NUMA node that has requested pci devices.

Implements: blueprint input-output-based-numa-scheduling
Change-Id: Id076a76d05f3d64facbeb60a7be3d4b60f817b94
Co-Authored-By: James Chapman <james.p.chapman@intel.com>

commit_message:
Update agent driver with new field driver_internal_info

Agent driver save agent_url/agent_last_heartbeat in driver_info before.
They are not input from admin, driver_internal_info should be the better
place.

Implements: blueprint driver-internal-info
Change-Id: Iaaa0081e3d4ab426832d5ddc5112606e2eda1e5f

subject: Make test helpers properly inheritable/extendable
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-02-04 09:48:50.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/test/helpers.py', 'horizon/test/helpers.py'], 'message': "Make test helpers properly inheritable/extendable

The helpers.TestCase classes didn't call their superclass' methods
in their setUp and tearDown methods, which made it impossible to
probperly inherit from them and use mixins with them.

I split the code that was differing for them into separate methods,
removed common code and made them use super() correctly.

Due to some inspect magic, the factory creation has to be duplicated.

Change-Id: I0bf909b1e4324c1e36bcdb83daece391bd0cfae7
"}]
commit_message:
Make test helpers properly inheritable/extendable

The helpers.TestCase classes didn't call their superclass' methods
in their setUp and tearDown methods, which made it impossible to
probperly inherit from them and use mixins with them.

I split the code that was differing for them into separate methods,
removed common code and made them use super() correctly.

Due to some inspect magic, the factory creation has to be duplicated.

Change-Id: I0bf909b1e4324c1e36bcdb83daece391bd0cfae7

commit_message:
added detail page for keypair

from keypair table, we can see only the
name and fingerprint of the keypair

in horizon we have no option to see the
id, created time and public key of
the keypair.

this patch adding a new detail page for
keypairs, which display the name fingerprint,
id, created time and public key.

Change-Id: Idb85f7e60090875e2e503806122cdb4ff637c341
Closes-Bug: #1413126

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4393, 'name': 'Dan Smith', 'email': 'dms@danplanet.com', 'username': 'danms'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 5441, 'name': 'Andrew Laski', 'email': 'andrew@lascii.com', 'username': 'alaski'}, {'_account_id': 5638, 'name': 'Davanum Srinivas', 'email': 'davanum@gmail.com', 'username': 'dims-v'}, {'_account_id': 9578, 'name': 'DB Datasets CI', 'email': 'turbo-hipster@lists.rcbops.com', 'username': 'turbo-hipster', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 11103, 'name': 'Intel PCI CI', 'email': 'otc_cloud@163.com', 'username': 'intelotccloud', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-03 20:23:25.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/cells/test_cells_rpc_driver.py', 'nova/cells/rpc_driver.py'], 'message': 'Fix cells rpc connection leak

Only create a Transport object once for each inter-cell hop.  This
prevents the cells rpc driver from creating a new connection pool
(and connection) for each inter-cell message sent.  This affects the
RabbitMQ and qpid transports.

This is a regression introduced by oslo.messaging commit
f3370da11a867bae287d7f549a671811e8b399ef which got rid stateful
tracking of connection pool references within oslo.messaging.
It is now the responsibility of the caller to manage these
references.

See related bug:
https://bugs.launchpad.net/oslo.messaging/+bug/1397925

Change-Id: Id1e75f456d4c0ef5b87bf3efe810e9fcfa4cce1d
Closes-Bug: #1417745
'}]
commit_message:
Fix cells rpc connection leak

Only create a Transport object once for each inter-cell hop.  This
prevents the cells rpc driver from creating a new connection pool
(and connection) for each inter-cell message sent.  This affects the
RabbitMQ and qpid transports.

This is a regression introduced by oslo.messaging commit
f3370da11a867bae287d7f549a671811e8b399ef which got rid stateful
tracking of connection pool references within oslo.messaging.
It is now the responsibility of the caller to manage these
references.

See related bug:
https://bugs.launchpad.net/oslo.messaging/+bug/1397925

Change-Id: Id1e75f456d4c0ef5b87bf3efe810e9fcfa4cce1d
Closes-Bug: #1417745

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-02-04 13:40:58.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/api/openstack/compute/test_servers.py', 'nova/compute/api.py'], 'message': 'Do not treat empty key_name as None

When running instance, empty ("") key_name is treated as None and
keypair lookup does not happen.  However, empty string is written to
key_name field in instance's database record.  When horizon renders
instance info, it looks up keypair if key_name is not None.  Having
empty string in this property generates error and instance info is not
displayed.

Change-Id: Ib67b124e6480f3435d31c983f1bfca769899c8e7
Closes-Bug: #1403544
'}]
commit_message:
Do not treat empty key_name as None

When running instance, empty ("") key_name is treated as None and
keypair lookup does not happen.  However, empty string is written to
key_name field in instance's database record.  When horizon renders
instance info, it looks up keypair if key_name is not None.  Having
empty string in this property generates error and instance info is not
displayed.

Change-Id: Ib67b124e6480f3435d31c983f1bfca769899c8e7
Closes-Bug: #1403544

subject: setfiles consistently
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-02-03 17:00:19.000000000', 'files': ['elements/rpm-distro/finalise.d/11-selinux-fixfiles-restore'], 'message': 'setfiles consistently

Working on host systems without selinux, where the guest image
does have selinux, creates a situation where the instance will
have about a 1 minute delay on first boot because it must relabel.
The previous check for sysfs assumes that the host system has
selinux, which is not needed for the guest setfiles to work.

Change-Id: Ic186a45991b6d80880ad635e9c80985612f53a05
Closes-bug: 1414200
'}]
commit_message:
setfiles consistently

Working on host systems without selinux, where the guest image
does have selinux, creates a situation where the instance will
have about a 1 minute delay on first boot because it must relabel.
The previous check for sysfs assumes that the host system has
selinux, which is not needed for the guest setfiles to work.

Change-Id: Ic186a45991b6d80880ad635e9c80985612f53a05
Closes-bug: 1414200

subject: Really preseed tempest testrepository from database
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2015-01-29 07:28:02.000000000', 'files': ['devstack-vm-gate.sh'], 'message': "Really preseed tempest testrepository from database

Recently support to nodepool was added for pre-seeding the tempest test
repository with data from the subunit2sql db. However the nodepool
script was preseeding the wrong git repo which wasn't used for tempest
in devstack gate runs. This commit loads the stream pulled from the
database by nodepool image creation.

Change-Id: I9ca156b7fcfe25b1052eb250d56ed57943881e9c
"}]
commit_message:
Really preseed tempest testrepository from database

Recently support to nodepool was added for pre-seeding the tempest test
repository with data from the subunit2sql db. However the nodepool
script was preseeding the wrong git repo which wasn't used for tempest
in devstack gate runs. This commit loads the stream pulled from the
database by nodepool image creation.

Change-Id: I9ca156b7fcfe25b1052eb250d56ed57943881e9c

We agreed at the Kilo summit that projects will write in-tree
functional tests, which may be executed in a targeted devstack
environment.
Introduce OVERRIDE_ENABLED_SERVICES so that projects which

commit_message:
Introduce OVERRIDE_ENABLED_SERVICES for func tests

We agreed at the Kilo summit that projects will write in-tree
functional tests, which may be executed in a targeted devstack
environment.
Introduce OVERRIDE_ENABLED_SERVICES so that projects which
want to used devstack for their test, may also reuse the d-g
scripts and fully customize the list of services installed
in their test clouds.

Change-Id: I4170166d9d0eff5995b330c85e0ce30592b0c0f4

subject: Ceph: wait for services to shutdown during cleanup
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 866, 'name': 'Chmouel Boudjnah', 'email': 'chmouel@chmouel.com', 'username': 'chmouel'}, {'_account_id': 970, 'name': 'Dean Troyer', 'email': 'dtroyer@gmail.com', 'username': 'dtroyer'}, {'_account_id': 4523, 'name': 'Eric Harney', 'email': 'eharney@redhat.com', 'username': 'eharney'}, {'_account_id': 6984, 'name': 'Sébastien Han', 'email': 'seb@redhat.com', 'username': 'leseb'}, {'_account_id': 7118, 'name': 'Ian Wienand', 'email': 'iwienand@redhat.com', 'username': 'iwienand'}, {'_account_id': 7175, 'name': 'Robbie Harwood', 'email': 'rharwood@redhat.com', 'username': 'frozencemetery'}, {'_account_id': 9009, 'name': 'Red Hat CI', 'email': 'redhatci@redhat.com', 'username': 'redhatci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-01-27 09:01:49.000000000', 'files': ['lib/ceph'], 'message': 'Ceph: wait for services to shutdown during cleanup

It can take ceph-osd and ceph-mon a few seconds to complete when
they are killed.  This races against the umount command in cleaup
and can often result in $CEPH_DATA_DIR failing to unmount since
it is still in use.

Wait for these processes to stop to ensure the mount point is
umounted successfully.

Change-Id: I1a635e75a68be6b14fbee52ff981b5f5a3a8eb0e
'}]
commit_message:
Ceph: wait for services to shutdown during cleanup

It can take ceph-osd and ceph-mon a few seconds to complete when
they are killed.  This races against the umount command in cleaup
and can often result in $CEPH_DATA_DIR failing to unmount since
it is still in use.

Wait for these processes to stop to ensure the mount point is
umounted successfully.

Change-Id: I1a635e75a68be6b14fbee52ff981b5f5a3a8eb0e

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-04 00:27:02.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/objects/test_instance.py'], 'message': "Fix corrupting the object repository with test instance objects

In order to test older instance versions in the remote instance
tests, we were creating an OldInstance object masquerading as a
proper Instance so we could override the version. That had the
potential to confuse other instance object tests because from that
point on, it was the first Instance object in the repository,
breaking the ordering requirement. Since we don't need it to be
called Instance to test what we want to test, this patch just
removes the masquerading bit.

Change-Id: Iabb77ea3084c3701bf67f051ace494a1efb12917
Closes-Bug: #1417678
"}]
commit_message:
Fix corrupting the object repository with test instance objects

In order to test older instance versions in the remote instance
tests, we were creating an OldInstance object masquerading as a
proper Instance so we could override the version. That had the
potential to confuse other instance object tests because from that
point on, it was the first Instance object in the repository,
breaking the ordering requirement. Since we don't need it to be
called Instance to test what we want to test, this patch just
removes the masquerading bit.

Change-Id: Iabb77ea3084c3701bf67f051ace494a1efb12917
Closes-Bug: #1417678

[{'number': 11, 'created': '2015-02-04 02:05:05.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/linux/dhcp.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/test_linux_dhcp.py'], 'message': 'Fix extra-dhcp-opt on stateless dhcpv6 subnet

The opts in dnsmasq opt-file is depending on the tag set
in the host-file. When you have only one stateless dhcpv6 subnet,
it will be filtered by the _iter_host() function, and will not be
written to the host-file, this may lead to extra-dhcp-opt not working.

Closes-Bug:#1411137

Change-Id: Ieed16280fb3c4c91f7d906c0410446d2a112b93e
'}]
commit_message:
Fix extra-dhcp-opt on stateless dhcpv6 subnet

The opts in dnsmasq opt-file is depending on the tag set
in the host-file. When you have only one stateless dhcpv6 subnet,
it will be filtered by the _iter_host() function, and will not be
written to the host-file, this may lead to extra-dhcp-opt not working.

Closes-Bug:#1411137

commit_message:
Avoid port delete failure with DVR

In some cases, the method of get_agent_by_type_and_host will cause
StaleDataError because of some race conditions. The code change is
to catch the Exception, continue deleting port.

Change-Id: I140c48edb6a40e1ae667f501a0226c895131f647
Closes-bug: 1398446

commit_message:
Make get_schema a classmethod

This patch makes get_schema a classmethod so that it can be called directly
which is needed in another patchset. In order to make get_schema a
classmethod I needed to introduce a new class variable TRANSLATORS in
each class which contrains a list of the translators.

Change-Id: I63193b6f1242ce212e101b4614314876a05e5460

commit_message:
Fix flake exclude matching of .*

When using \.* for a match, flake8 tests all files in .venv on my
machine. Replacing this match with ./.* fixes the issue.

Change-Id: If5617daad95e8b33888b672e36f38ade07d7cb89

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6786, 'name': 'Sergey Lukjanov', 'email': 'me@slukjanov.name', 'username': 'slukjanov'}, {'_account_id': 7213, 'name': 'Sahara Hadoop Cluster CI', 'email': 'elastic-hadoop-ci@mirantis.com', 'username': 'savanna-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 7535, 'name': 'Nikolay Starodubtsev', 'email': 'starodubcevna@gmail.com', 'username': 'Kezar'}, {'_account_id': 7710, 'name': 'Sergey Reshetnyak', 'email': 'sreshetniak@mirantis.com', 'username': 'sreshetniak'}, {'_account_id': 10670, 'name': 'Michael McCune', 'email': 'elmiko@redhat.com', 'username': 'mimccune'}, {'_account_id': 12038, 'name': 'Vitaly Gridnev', 'email': 'gridnevvvit@gmail.com', 'username': 'vgridnev'}, {'_account_id': 12039, 'name': 'Andrey Pavlov', 'email': 'apavlov@mirantis.com', 'username': 'apavlov'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-03 23:14:23.000000000', 'files': ['sahara/tests/unit/service/validation/test_cluster_create_validation.py', 'sahara/tests/unit/service/validation/utils.py'], 'message': 'Fixed unit tests failures caused by missing patch stops

Found two ways how mock patches could be left after test run:

* If the same object mocked twice it should be released in the
  reversed order. Overwise it stays mocked.
* Each method MUST make sure that it stops mocking. Found one
  place where it is not true.

Both reasons could be a cause of `test_list_registered_images`
method failure since it relies on unmocked nova client.

Change-Id: I71ea009ec0318ad9437210a8bbf5d5cc7be87a80
Closes-Bug: #1417256
'}]
commit_message:
Fixed unit tests failures caused by missing patch stops

Found two ways how mock patches could be left after test run:

* If the same object mocked twice it should be released in the
  reversed order. Overwise it stays mocked.
* Each method MUST make sure that it stops mocking. Found one
  place where it is not true.

Both reasons could be a cause of `test_list_registered_images`
method failure since it relies on unmocked nova client.

Change-Id: I71ea009ec0318ad9437210a8bbf5d5cc7be87a80
Closes-Bug: #1417256

update verb. Except the one new PUT method for granting a role.

Multiple DELETE is removed from the overloaded POST actions, and the role
grant is moved to a PUT action.

The new angular API service implements error handling by default.

The request Python API JSON body test was made more sane. Thanks to all the

Change-Id: Ifd58fbf4fac3c3f53dc4769fd76cddfa3101d9d2
'}]
commit_message:
Alter verb usage for keystone REST and add Angular service

This patch adds an Angular service to isolate client-side code from REST API
changes, and also changes the REST API to use PATCH instead of PUT as the
update verb. Except the one new PUT method for granting a role.

Multiple DELETE is removed from the overloaded POST actions, and the role
grant is moved to a PUT action.

The new angular API service implements error handling by default.

The request Python API JSON body test was made more sane. Thanks to all the
reviewers who brought that up, I finally saw the light!

Change-Id: Ifd58fbf4fac3c3f53dc4769fd76cddfa3101d9d2

commit_message:
Pass root_helper to ip_lib by keyword argument to prep for removal

To assist in being able to stop passing the root_helper option to
various classes/functions and instead handle root_helper just in
execute(), pass root_helper in advanced services via keyword
argument, so that the root_helper removal patch will be able to
accept, but ignore it and still have tests pass.

Change-Id: I52402b0f71c9ae37a6113ea16e66fc4af7daf562

commit_message:
Configures namespace deletion

Add option to the L3 and DHCP agent configuration to
enable automatic deletion of router and DHCP namespaces
when the router or network is deleted.

Change-Id: I75d5eb4bac4b1d163b44f7ea27db01b62a80bedd
backport: Juno
Closes-Bug: 1404941

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-02-04 19:44:45.000000000', 'files': ['congress/tests/base.py', 'congress/tests/db/test_db_policy_rules.py'], 'message': "Fix failing test case TestDsePerformance

This testcase TestDsePerformance did not set the db url so the tests would
sometimes fail (not sure why they didn't always fail). Anyways, this patch
fixes this issue by setting the config option in the base class that
deals with tests that use the db. Moving this here ensures no one needs to
call this method in testcases which touch the db which is better anyways.

Closes-bug: 1418188

Change-Id: Ibc6121f6671af62498d2baa23c14e60aef9b356d
"}]
commit_message:
Fix failing test case TestDsePerformance

This testcase TestDsePerformance did not set the db url so the tests would
sometimes fail (not sure why they didn't always fail). Anyways, this patch
fixes this issue by setting the config option in the base class that
deals with tests that use the db. Moving this here ensures no one needs to
call this method in testcases which touch the db which is better anyways.

Closes-bug: 1418188

Change-Id: Ibc6121f6671af62498d2baa23c14e60aef9b356d

In the recent commit, True/False of boolean argument
became case-insensitve and this code is copy-and-paste'ed

       parser.add_argument(
           '--enabled',

"}]
commit_message:
Utility method for boolean argument

In the recent commit, True/False of boolean argument
became case-insensitve and this code is copy-and-paste'ed
in several places.

Now there are several number of patches which add explicit
arguments for *-update or *-list and the code of boolean
argumetns like below will be used more than now.

This commit add a utility method to register such boolean opt.

       parser.add_argument(
           '--enabled',
           dest='enabled', metavar='{True,False}',
           choices=['True', 'true', 'False', 'false'],
           help=_('Whether to enable or disable this rule.'),
           default=argparse.SUPPRESS)

Change-Id: I9575eeef32154a8b92589c2cc7889803216bddb2

commit_message:
NTP service can fail or be slow to stop

On some system the ntpd process can be slow to stop if at all.
With this change double check that ntpd has stopped correctly
before we use nptdate.

Change-Id: I844203ad031bf23f6be1c7d58d434139a19bf221

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-02-04 00:29:55.000000000', 'files': ['nova/cmd/manage.py'], 'message': 'Change cell_type values in nova-manage

The option “cell_type” in nova.conf was introduced with the
deprecation of “compute_api_class” option. It specifies the
cell type as “api” or “compute”. However, when creating a cell
using “nova-manage” the cell type “parent” or “child” is expected.

This patch changes “nova-manage” to accept the cell type “api” and
“compute”. Cell type “parent” and “child” are still accepted.

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1414480

Change-Id: Icc0cba4f4d56911a65d586cbc0cfdb904ecc15ba
'}]
commit_message:
Change cell_type values in nova-manage

The option “cell_type” in nova.conf was introduced with the
deprecation of “compute_api_class” option. It specifies the
cell type as “api” or “compute”. However, when creating a cell
using “nova-manage” the cell type “parent” or “child” is expected.

This patch changes “nova-manage” to accept the cell type “api” and
“compute”. Cell type “parent” and “child” are still accepted.

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1414480

Change-Id: Icc0cba4f4d56911a65d586cbc0cfdb904ecc15ba

commit_message:
Add Sorting Guidelines

document.

Adds driver for Murano datasource

model. Excludes python-muranoclient from requirements.txt.

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-04 09:20:38.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/tests/conductor/test_manager.py'], 'message': 'Rename provision_state to power_state in test_manager.py

This patch fixes a typo in _create_node helper of test_manager.py.
The attribute dictionary incorrectly refers to power state values
with a key named provision_state.

No tests were failing due to the typo, but the fix improves the

commit_message:
Rename provision_state to power_state in test_manager.py

This patch fixes a typo in _create_node helper of test_manager.py.
The attribute dictionary incorrectly refers to power state values
with a key named provision_state.

No tests were failing due to the typo, but the fix improves the
readability of the code for future maintainers.

Change-Id: Ibaf75a3d22d650fc77b67d6fd5164b78da83f2a3

revisions:
[{'number': 12, 'created': '2015-01-27 16:36:01.000000000', 'files': ['nova/exception.py', 'nova/tests/unit/db/test_db_api.py', 'nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py'], 'message': "Replace select-for-update in fixed_ip_associate_pool

MySQL Galera does not support the write-intent locks
that SELECT FOR UPDATE requires. In this patch SELECT
FOR UPDATE in 'fixed_ip_associate_pool' function
was replaced with SELECT and UPDATE.

The problems with MySQL Galera and algorithm of replacing
SELECT FOR UPDATE relate to spec
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/135296

Also this patch fixes incorrect network assigning
because previously the relationship 'network' was
updated instead of column 'network_id'.

Change-Id: I403da67a8d55aa30c9abcc491f71918cd2b452dd
"}]
commit_message:
Replace select-for-update in fixed_ip_associate_pool

MySQL Galera does not support the write-intent locks
that SELECT FOR UPDATE requires. In this patch SELECT
FOR UPDATE in 'fixed_ip_associate_pool' function
was replaced with SELECT and UPDATE.

The problems with MySQL Galera and algorithm of replacing
SELECT FOR UPDATE relate to spec
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/135296

Also this patch fixes incorrect network assigning
because previously the relationship 'network' was
updated instead of column 'network_id'.

Change-Id: I403da67a8d55aa30c9abcc491f71918cd2b452dd

commit_message:
Add the base method for the benchmarking of VMs

The base method that performs the necessary tasks (boot and gain access
to the virtual machine, execute the benchmark, collect the results, and
return as JSON) for running benchmarks in the virtual machines.

Co-Authored-By: Tzanetos Balitsaris <tzabal@freebsd.org>
Implements: blueprint benchmark-vms
Change-Id: I4f5c2a657ef54b96626d89cae796373825d2b30a

subject: Fix some comments.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-01-27 19:32:25.000000000', 'files': ['rally/benchmark/scenarios/vm/vmtasks.py'], 'message': 'Fix some comments.

The new boot_ping method copied from boot_runcommand_delete
has some minor differences.  Specifically, we are not running
a script, and as such the comments are updated to be clear
on the differences.  Furthermore, since we're using
@base.atomic_action_timer("vm.wait_for_ping")
in .../vm/utils.py to track times and success rate, we
return a simple json as expected.  Nothing further is required.

Change-Id: Icdb78fb8e7196fdcdffaa6064cf7457dc71b7b24
'}]
commit_message:
Fix some comments.

The new boot_ping method copied from boot_runcommand_delete
has some minor differences.  Specifically, we are not running
a script, and as such the comments are updated to be clear
on the differences.  Furthermore, since we're using
@base.atomic_action_timer("vm.wait_for_ping")
in .../vm/utils.py to track times and success rate, we
return a simple json as expected.  Nothing further is required.

Change-Id: Icdb78fb8e7196fdcdffaa6064cf7457dc71b7b24

revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2015-02-04 09:51:48.000000000', 'files': ['nailgun/nailgun/test/performance/base.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/test/performance/conftest.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/test/performance/csv_generator.py'], 'message': "Nailgun performance tests data gathering

This change is intended to work with jenkins changes, that will copy
data accumulated from previous builds, but it also works fine while
running performance tests on local machine. Local runs won't benefit
from jenkins historic data though.

The csv file is created by py.test hook located in
nailgun/nailgun/test/performance/conftest.py

It runs after run_test.sh is invoked with -x option

Fixed bugs:
* Loading json data from nonexistent file (first run of tests when
previous_results doesn't exist yet)

Implements: blueprint 200-nodes-support
Change-Id: Iba9a71b5080693c2b5fd31640a4a4bfd9ff89eb6
"}]
commit_message:
Nailgun performance tests data gathering

This change is intended to work with jenkins changes, that will copy
data accumulated from previous builds, but it also works fine while
running performance tests on local machine. Local runs won't benefit
from jenkins historic data though.

The csv file is created by py.test hook located in
nailgun/nailgun/test/performance/conftest.py

It runs after run_test.sh is invoked with -x option

Fixed bugs:
* Loading json data from nonexistent file (first run of tests when
previous_results doesn't exist yet)

Implements: blueprint 200-nodes-support
Change-Id: Iba9a71b5080693c2b5fd31640a4a4bfd9ff89eb6

commit_message:
Updated for version bump

This change preps the required files to point everything at the correct
versions for release.
* The file "rpc_deployment/vars/repo_packages/os_ansible_deployment.yml" is no longer
  needed and has been removed.
* Heat templates have been set to point to the icehouse Branches.
* Release version has been set to version 9.0.6.
* The raxmon agent release tag has been set to the 9.0.6

Change-Id: I71ed1157f39f0fd73ec1f64eaddc29b880ac7d75
